hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When major crypto regulatory news triggers initial volatility spike followed by 24-hour compression (ATR < 50% of spike), the subsequent breakout direction predicts 3-day trend with 65% accuracy in NEUTRAL regimes.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Regulatory news creates information asymmetry; initial volatility represents uncertainty absorption, compression indicates market digestion, breakout reveals institutional positioning direction. Current CLARITY Act news provides ideal test case.
entry_conditions: Major regulatory news event (CLARITY Act, ETF approval/rejection, etc.)
Following 24-hour period shows ATR compression to < 50% of spike level
Price consolidates within 1.5% range during compression
Breakout candle closes beyond compression range with volume > 120% 20-period average

exit_conditions.stop_loss: 1.5 ATR from entry opposite breakout direction

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout direction reversal within 12 hours occurs > 40% of time, or compression periods > 48 hours invalidate signal.
